alert.note: Alert for Lehigh; Northampton; Upper Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 6:27PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lehigh, northwestern Bucks and south central Northampton Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Allentown, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Hellertown, Pleasant Valley, Zionsville, Geryville, Springtown, Lehigh University, Ancient Oaks, Catasauqua, Fountain Hill, Coplay, Macungie, Coopersburg, Richlandtown, Fullerton and Hokendauqua. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 43 and 59. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 52 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
